boardgame.name: Premonitions
boardgame.description:
For over a hundred years, sightless prophets foretold of events that would shake civilization. Every society made use of these special visionaries. But 30 years ago, these seers suddenly saw an even that they kept to themselves. Then they came, the other beings. Aliens, made of twisting metaphysical flesh, poured from portals and conquered Earth. Now oppressed under the rule of these strange creatures, humans have outlawed the prophets we once relied on. Both the alien overlords and loyal cultists protect these seers with their lives.

You are a hunter. It is your job to find and execute these traitors of mankind or their alien agents.

Premonitions is a sci-fi, investigative, solo RPG. You will conduct investigations, gathering clues, then piece the puzzle together before confronting your mark.

boardgame.name: Bezzerwizzer Ord
boardgame.description:
A Bezzerwizzer game focused on words.
Rules for points are the same as ordinary Bezzerwizzer, but the categories are more word- and language-related.

boardgame.name: Geestenvlucht
Geisterflucht
boardgame.description:
Geisterflucht ("Ghost escape") combines an exciting game with the technology of a drone to an action-packed and exciting children's game.

The players must skillfully flick their ghosts over the launch pad to land in the drone. As soon as a ghost is inside the drone, the engine starts and 3 seconds later the drone takes off. The escape is successful and the ghost has escaped! But watch out: Before the drone takes off, the other players can fight for the place.

Who is quick and skilled to help all his ghosts escape?

—description from the publisher

listing.notes: Shipping is possible for an additional charge

boardgame.name: Excalibur (Year 7, Issue 44/45 - 1997)
boardgame.description: Special double issue: 96 pages + 32 pages insert (adventures).

boardgame.name: Terrors and Tommyguns
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.




Publisher's blurb:

The city never sleeps, though a lot of folks wish it would. Beyond the din and clatter of mundane city life, something sinister lurks beneath New Babylon. Cultists gather in the night, seeking to summon the Old Gods. Crime bosses summon dark powers and seek to solidify their power as brave men and women stand against them, betting their sanity on keeping the city, and the world, safe for one more day. Above it all, a strange Collective looms, policing all matters Occult, and keeping the dark forces hidden from the world at large– but even their motives, and methods, are dangerous and ultimately unknown.

Welcome to Terrors and Tommyguns! Terrors and Tommyguns is a cinematic take on cosmic horror blended lovingly with old film noir and served dry and dirty with a few olives to boot (NOTE: OLIVES SOLD SEPARATELY). It takes place in the eponymous, sprawling city of New Babylon. The technology level is 1920s– there are tommy guns and radios, but not televisions or cell phones. Blending the feel of pulp noir with the unpredictable, chaotic feel of cosmic horror, players will assume the role of members of The Collective, a loose-knit society that exists in the underbelly of New Babylon. Will they be a hardened detective, taking on supernatural as well as mundane snooping jobs and wet work? Will they let themselves be lured in by the Old Gods, trading their loyalty (and their sanity) for power? Will they seek to bolster the ranks of The Collective, seeking to learn the motives and origins of its mysterious leader, Lux Hammersmith? Although the Collective has lofty goals, it also protects the worst of New Babylon’s occult denizens. For those unlucky souls chosen for it or incidentally exposed to it, membership in The Collective is neither comfortable nor easy and there is only one way to exit The Collective– a permanent dirt nap.

The road you choose will be your own, but it won’t be an easy one.

boardgame.name: Hexinos
boardgame.description:
A tile placement game for all ages, this intuitive-to-play and fast moving game involves pattern (tile edge) matching and spatial recognition. The game is played with six-sided tiles, each edge having either one, two, three or four pips.

Usually a 2-4 player game, Hexinos can be played by five player (six is unwieldly and its too long between turns).

All players start each turn with two tiles (hidden from the other players). On their turn the player places one of those two tiles onto the game table, matching at least one edge of their six sided tile to a tile edge already on the game table. That placement is immediately scored (see below), the player retrieves another tile from the facedown tilepile and then the player to their left takes their turn. Play continues until all tiles have been placed.

There are two ways of scoring Hexinos tile placement: Basic and Advanced. Basic can be used with younger kids or just to make the game play go a bit faster.

Basic scoring is super basic - if the player matches:

+ one edge of their tile to one edge of a tile already on the game table: score one point

+ two edges of their tile: score three points

+ three edges of their tile: score six points

+ four edges of their tile: score ten points

+ five edges of their tile: score fifteen points

+ all edges of their tile - the "perfect match": that player wins immediately.

Advanced scoring requires both addition and multiplication:

+ one edge of their tile to one edge of a tile already on the game table: score one point for each pip on that matching edge of the player's tile (e.g. if the matching tile edge has three pips, its three points (not six))

+ two edge match: count total pips on the matching edges of the players tile, then multiply that by two

+ three edge match: count total pips on the matching edges of the players tile, then multiply that by three

+ four edge match: count total pips on the matching edges of the players tile, then multiply that by four

+ five edge match: count total pips on the matching edges of the players tile, then multiply that by five

For both Basic and Advanced scoring - if the placed tile closes off an empty tile space (called "bridging"), the placing player scores as usual for the edges that match, then a bonus of six points for each empty hex that has been closed off.

A note about younger players:
As long as the player can hold and place the tiles, Hexinos can be played at any age. For younger players it encourages both pattern matching and spatial recognition - seeing their tile with an edge with 2 pips next to a 3 pip edge, but does that match what is on the tiles already on the table, or is the 2 & 3 "backwards"? And with the basic scoring system, kids easily grasp the benefit of "more edges matching is better" without needed to know addition or multiplication.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Letters from France
boardgame.description:
User summary:

In Letters from France player characters are World War I nurses who write letters home to various people detailing their experiences near the front.

The basic idea for the mechanics used here was inspired by this discussion - QOTD OCT 6: As a player in an RPG, is it important to you that you believe there is a chance that your character will fail?
boardgame.rpghonor: 2020 RPG Geek 24 Hour RPG 1st Place Winner

boardgame.name: Hegemony
Hegemony: Lead Your Class to Victory
boardgame.description:
The Nation is in disarray and a war is waging between the classes. The working class faces a dismantled welfare system, the capitalists are losing their hard-earned profits, the middle class is gradually fading and the state is sinking into a deep deficit. Amidst all this chaos, the only person who can provide guidance is... you. Will you take the side of the working class and fight for social reforms? Or will you stand with the corporations and the free market? Will you help the government try to keep it all together, or will you try to enforce your agenda no matter the cost to the country?

Hegemony is an asymmetric politico-economic card-driven board game for 2-4 players that puts you in the role of one of the socio-economic groups in a fictional state: The Working Class, the Middle Class, the Capitalist Class and the State itself.

The Working class controls the workers. The Capitalist class controls the companies. The Middle class combines elements from both the Working class and the Capitalist. It has workers who can work in the Capitalist's companies but it can also build companies of its own, yet smaller. Finally the State is trying to keep everyone happy, providing benefits and subsidies when needed but trying also to maintain a steady income through taxes to avoid going into debt.

While players have their own separate goals, they are all limited by a series of policies that affect most of their actions, like Taxation, Labor Market, Foreign Trade etc. Voting on those policies and using their influence to change them is also very important. Through careful planning, strategic actions and political maneuvering, you will do your best to increase the power of your class and carry out your agenda. Will you be the one to lead your class to victory?

Hegemony is heavily based on actual academic principles such as Social-Democracy, Neoliberalism, Nationalism and Globalism, and allows players to see their real world applications through engaging gameplay. There are many ways to achieve hegemony- which one will you take?

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The 7th Citadel: L'Alambic de Valengarde
The 7th Citadel: The Alembic of Valengarde
boardgame.description:
This expansion will send you in search of the pieces of the famous Alembic of Valengarde, which split into 3 upon Ninidazir’s death and have been wandering the country ever since.

Whether you search out each piece or come across them by happy accident, you will need to 'transport' them to the same Terrain card. Once they are grouped together, you will be able to open this mysterious little box that contains the - permanently - reconstructed Alembic of Valengarde.

Of course, this will not be an easy task, because saving the game or returning to the Citadel before completing this task will cause the mischievous pieces of Alembic to wander off, forcing you to begin your search anew.

But you can take our word for it, it's well worth the trouble!

Contents: 30 cards, 4 minis.

boardgame.name: Colony of Death
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This book contains 4 adventures set in the English Colony of Maryland in 1650. It also provides setting information, a hex map, random encounter tables, and a bestiary of creatures from Maryland folklore.

The Colony of Maryland was founded on the idea that Catholics and Protestants could live together in peace, to build a new life in a New World.

But things dark and sinister lurk in these ancient woods. Things the natives leave undisturbed. Things alien and evil. And being exposed unknowingly by eager, greedy settlers.

All are damned in the Colony of Death.

boardgame.name: Warlock Grimoire 2
Warlock Grimoire II
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Open a Chamber of Hidden Lore!

DARKLY FANTASTIC MATERIAL FOR THE WORLD’S FIRST RPG

Within these dusty pages, uncover the secrets of the world—indeed, of the branches of the multiverse! Collected here are entire lost volumes of esoteric truths. Only for you, the Warlock Grimoire 2!

Dark revelations and wondrous testimonials of dark fantasy monsters and magic, locales and lore of Midgard:

Details on the indefatigable halflings: the winterfolk, riverfolk, and courtfolk
Explosive realities of dwarven firearms and airships
Hidden vaults filled with treasure and danger
Potent magics and professions from the trenches of wartime
Magic-slinging NPCs to fill any role, ready to go
An epidemic of automata and a proliferation of clockwork druids
Ancient and mysterious vril-powered artifacts
Gothic horrors of the Blood Kingdom, vampires and more
Boss monsters to capstone any adventure
Even a tour of the Eleven Hells and the infernal crossroads town of Smoke
Plus 10 subclasses, 7 backgrounds, 9 feats, 29 complete NPCs, 2 diseases, 24 spells & invocations, 96 magic items & equipment, 42 monsters, and much more!


The Warlock Grimoire 2 presents the content from issues 10–19 of the Warlock zine and includes an entire issue’s worth of new, never-before-seen lore and game elements, including both the mysteriously desolated Southlands city of Iram and the secrets of Grandmother herself, Baba Yaga.

Uncover the truths of dark fantasy for the Midgard campaign setting—or for the worlds of your own creation!

boardgame.name: Kaiju Girls
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

YOU are a teenage girl who has to deal with all the regular worries of people your age – getting good grades at school, the expectations of the adults around you, falling in and out of love, and staying abreast of all the latest news about your friends. And as if that’s not enough, when you get too stressed, you transform into a skyscraper-sized monster and start demolishing the city! Can you be happy, excel at your academic pursuits, AND rescue citizens from the insidious attentions of giant alien robot invaders?

boardgame.name: The Northderry Mining Guild
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

An Introductory Campaign for Mithgarthr Second Edition!

The town of Northderry, nestled in the foothills of the Tralaberg Mountains to the west of Riverton, is a picturesque mining community that proudly exports over half of the copper used throughout the entire kingdom of Karak.

Bandrem Ironfinger, from the Northderry Mining Guild, has recently learned of the existence of map which leads to a rich gold vein, and he must have it. If only there were townsfolk willing to take on the mantle of adventurer to retrieve it...

The Northderry Mining Guild is an introductory campaign for the second edition of the Mithgarthr Role-Playing Game that picks up where the adventure in the back of the Mithgarthr rulebook left off, and takes your characters from level 1 up to level 3. Featuring a large, multi-level dungeon main adventure, multiple side-quests, new magic items, and new monsters, this campaign provides many sessions’ worth of adventure to kick off a new second edition Mithgarthian campaign!

boardgame.name: Unhallowed Data
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A CHILLING MYSTERY IN THE DEPTHS OF GODNET...

Unhallowed Data is a massive adventure suitable for several months of gaming. The Delphi Council has a chance to slip a team into the Cyberpapacy under the guise of special investigators for the Inquisition, but what happens when the Cyberpope requests that team to look into rumors of demons and betrayal?

Someone inside the Church has sinister plans. Follow the clues through dark monasteries, mean urban sprawls, and even into the GodNet to discover a secret more dangerous than the Church itself!

INSIDE YOU’LL FIND:

A massive Seven Act extended adventure that crosses the different regions of the Cyberpapacy.
Gain the status to move freely though the Church‘s realm - perhaps permanently!
New foes to face and allies to win over!

boardgame.name: WizDice R&W
boardgame.description:
WizDice is a roll and write game in which players pretend to be sorcerers in training, the final exam is about and they must fight among all the applicants, there will only be one pass ... will it be you?
WizDice is a game for 1 to 5 players, with an approximate duration of 45 minutes.
In the game each player controls their learning sheet and through this they must cast spells, summon creatures, prepare your lesson book and gain experience in order to attack the other players, the player who is the first to leave will win. KO a player.
During the game, the player in turn will throw X dice, choose the ones that help him the most and leave some for the other wizards, collect different elements depending on the chosen dice, these elements will then serve to cast powerful spells against a player of his choice.
-Remember this is the final exam and alliances are short-lived in WizDice.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.description: Promo scenario for To The Death, consisting of six cards celebrating the designers wedding day.

boardgame.name: Pirate Islands: Isle of Wrecks
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Experienced sailors know to avoid the rocks that edge the Isle of Wrecks. But even they are helpless when a storm blows them off course and onto the unforgiving rocks.

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 20 x 20 map depiciting a tropical island with jagged rocks, wrecked ships and washed up debris.. Sandy beaches, steep cliffs, dense jungle and wrecked ships.. Ideal for pirate adventures, searching for treasure!

boardgame.name: Pirate Islands: Isle of Skulls
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The large stone skulls that give this island it's name have stood for centuries, welcoming or warning those who visit the island. Some grizzled sailors even claim to have seen them moving their jaws, opening up to reveal cursed treasure!

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 20 x 20 map depiciting a tropical island covered with several large stone, carved skulls in the cliffs. Sandy beaches, steep cliffs, dense jungle and sinister carvings.. Ideal for pirate adventures, searching for treasure!

boardgame.name: Pit of Roiling Darkness
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 524th of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features a pit reaching deep into the mountain, filled with some kind of roiling darkness.

The map is 28 x 30 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 12 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

The product has been updated to include a large gridless JPG image of the map, intended for use with VTT software. It is 2016x2160 pixels in size at 72dpi.

boardgame.name: Punk's Been Dead Since '79
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Fuck this town, man.

You've got a thirty minute drive to the nearest mall. It's got a population of 3200. But only on Fridays during football season. There are 13 churches within a half mile of the town center. The nearest city with more than 10000 people is an hour drive away. There are five other punks in town and none of you really get along. But you have to complain to someone about the normals.

boardgame.name: Legendary: A Marvel Deck Building Game – Realm of Kings
boardgame.description:
In the Realm of Kings a throne is never safe. Even for the mighty Black Bolt, King of the Inhumans, the challengers from both within and without are many and without mercy. In this 24th expansion to Legendary, command the unearthly powers of the Inhuman Royal Family as you fend off mutinous family members and cosmic conquerors like the Shi’ar Empire. Defend the throne in Legendary, the king of deck building card games.


Players can work both with and against other players to defeat evil!
All cards contain original art!
Requires the Marvel Legendary Core Set to play.
Realm of Kings includes an infusion of high-powered Inhumans and comic characters to the vast pool of amazing content for Legendary.
24th Expansion to the vast Legendary Landscape!
5 Heroes! 2 new Masterminds and Villain groups!


—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Street Masters: Tide of the Dragon
boardgame.description:
Street Masters: Tide of the Dragon is a standalone expansion for Street Masters, the critically-acclaimed cooperative miniatures board game of street brawling action for 1-4 players. Designed by veteran game designers Adam and Brady Sadler with Scott McFall and Mitch Schroeder, and heavily influenced by classic “beat ‘em up” arcade games and Hong Kong action movies of yesteryear, Tide of the Dragon is a standalone experience that contains everything needed to play, but also allows returning Street Masters fans to use its all-new fighters, enemy factions, stages, and other modular elements with the rest of the products in the fan-favorite game series that has been lauded since its debut in 2017.

Expanding on the modular nature of Streets Masters, Tide of the Dragon includes a new way to further customize players’ experiences. Terrain cards allow fighters to introduce new terrain elements to their battles, such as ladders that can be used to climb up and away from enemies or fire hydrants that can launch a powerful water stream to damage opponents.

Street Masters: Tide of the Dragon includes 52 highly detailed miniatures; 4 New Fighters with their own unique Fighter and Hero Story Decks; a New Double-Sided Map Tile with 2 New Stage Decks; 2 New Enemy Factions with unique Enemy and Showdown Decks; 4 Terrain Cards; a Tide of the Dragon Story Deck; 12 New Ally/Rival cards, and all the dice, tokens, dividers and base rings needed to play right out of the box!

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Gygax OD&D Additions
boardgame.description:
User summary:

This intriguing document draws on a variety of citations to present the viewpoint and house rules used through the years by the founder of roleplaying.

The document begins by providing the source material citations drawn on; it covers house rules used through 2007.

The document is the result of a discussion held on a public forum.

boardgame.description: 64 pages + 16 pages insert (adventures)

boardgame.name: Stagecoach
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

This is a live-action role-playing (LARP) scenario set in the Serenity/Firefly universe...I first ran it at GenCon Indy 2007. The original event description is as follows:

The Coronado is a high-speed armed transport, owned by the Companion's Guild and operated by Captain Frances Granger to protect their interests in the outer worlds. But in a time of crisis from Reaver attacks, she has agreed to take on priority passengers bound for Regina. But all is not as it seems. An event heavy on role-playing, with intrigue and tension. Fancy Old West or Chinese themed clothing suggested but not required.

boardgame.name: Shadows in the Fog
boardgame.description:
Occult Roleplaying in Jack the Ripper's London

From the introduction:

In the autumn of 1888, horror convulsed London. A series of brutal murders committed by an unknown maniac terrified and fascinated people from all walks of life. An enterprising journalist, or perhaps a random prankster, bestowed on this killer an extraordinary and enduring sobriquet: Jack the Ripper.

Despite numerous close calls, and thousands of possible clues, Jack was never caught.

Ironically, Saucy Jack’s reign of terror, which left at least five women dead, turned out to be one of the best things that ever happened to the poverty-stricken East End. Newspaper readers clamored for further developments on the case; in their absence, journalists began to report on “local color,” bringing nationwide attention to one of the worst slums in Europe. Victorian society, which had gloried in the wealthiest and most important city in the world, came to realize that in constructing their beloved capitol, they had allowed the most abject poverty, hunger, and disease to blight a vast populace.

Theories about the Ripper abound — and continue to be produced at a phenomenal rate. Was he a syphilitic bent on revenge against the prostitutes who infected him? Was he the result of a plot concocted by Freemasons? Was he a black magician seeking power through blood sacrifice? Was he merely an opportunistic and lucky serial murderer who stopped killing when he got tired of the game? All these theories, and many more, have been proposed. In this game, you will explore the possibilities.

But this is a fantasy game, not history. You will explore an alternate London, one in which the various occultists, cranks, theorists, and visionaries are all possibly correct — perhaps even simultaneously so. You will explore both the hypocrisy and the successes of Victorian society, wending your way among the saintly and the wicked, the gentle and the vicious, the poor and the rich, the nobility and the whores. And you will create this world in the image of your desires and fantasies, bending it to your will.

Welcome to Shadows in the Fog.

boardgame.name: Age of Paranoia
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The plague of suspicion, distrust, disinformation, conspiracy consciousness that has emanated like gamma radiation from intelligence agencies East and West, the pervasive feeling of unfathomable deceit that has destabilized our confidence in the knowability of history.

The Age of Paranoia is a roleplaying game, in the style of John Le Carre and The Sandbaggers, that utilizes the Cold War to tell the story of individuals who have chosen to follow the Secret Road.

User summary:

Developed on a public wiki, Age of Paranoia was a port and revision of Shadows in the Fog to a new, modern genre.

boardgame.name: Inferno and Glory
Inferno and Glory: Fast Play Fleet Action Rules for Renaissance Naval Warfare in the Age of the Galley
boardgame.description:
A quick playing set of fleet action level Renaissance naval rules covering the period 1450 to 1600, allowing large scale battles such as Lepanto and Prevesa to be completed in a couple of hours or less.
They have been written with 1/2400 scale models based in groups or stands, with each stand representing 5 to 10 ships.
A range of suitable 3D models are available for free download to accompany the rules.
Bookkeeping is minimal, using simple markers to indicate ship damage and crew casualties.
Data for over 30 different broad ship types and ten different fleet lists are included, covering the major fleets and city states of the Mediterranean.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Counter Attacks
Digit Draughts
boardgame.description:
Digit Draughts is a set of three related games played using the same equipment: a standard 8x8 Checkers (Draughts) board and two sets of 12 checkers. Each set of checkers is numbered 1-6 twice.

In each game the pieces are randomly placed in the usual Checkers starting positions. (A variant is given where after determining first player, the second player's pieces are re-arranged to match the first player's.)

Game 1 is played like Checkers except that a piece can only jump a piece with an equal or lower number. The object is to capture both opposing 6s, although a player also wins if their opponent can no longer move.

In Game 2 players score points every time they make a jump - normally the absolute difference between the jumping piece's number and that on the piece being jumped, but if the numbers add to seven or eleven that many points are scored instead. When no captures can be made remaining pieces are added to players' scores.

Game 3 also uses scoring, in a different way. In this game when a piece is jumped the capturing player keeps it in front of them in a scoring area, and when a piece reaches the back row it is removed and added to its owner's scoring area. (There are no kings.) The winner is the first player to reach 30 points.

boardgame.name: Top Trumps Quiz: The Celtic Football Club
boardgame.description:
Are you a Celtic fan?
Can you identify how many players have scored more than 200 goals for the team?
Can you remember specific games from European campaigns?
Travel back to the origins of Celtic FC via the pinnacle of Europe in May 1967 and right up to today's star players.
Test your Bhoys knowledge to see if you come top of the table.

With 500 questions to answer, it's great for the whole family, whether you want a quick game on the go or to spend some time seeing how much you really know!
With a Top Trumps twist at the end to test your memory, can you remember what you learned just moments ago?

Key Details:

Quizzical fun with a Top Trumps Twist.
Entertaining educational card game loved for bringing your favourite subjects to life including questions on the Lisbon Lions, stadium and legendary players and managers.
500 puzzling and captivating questions that will test your knowledge and memory.
Easy-to-carry plastic case means there are no limits on gameplay.
Prepare to outsmart your opponents, discover new and exciting facts and duel your way to becoming the Top Trump.

boardgame.name: Escale au Touquet Paris-Plage
boardgame.description:
The game "Escale au Touquet Paris-Plage" is the ideal game to have a good time with family and friends.

Roll dice and move your pawn throughout the the seaside resort of Le Touquet from space to space.
The goal is to be the first player to complete a schedule of activities (find accommodation, a restaurant to eat, go shopping, etc.) before arriving at the "town hall" space.
The players also have banknotes to practice all their activities.
It's up to them to manage their expenses properly in a similar way as monopoly ...

boardgame.name: Escale à Berck sur Mer
boardgame.description:
Roll dice and move your pawn throughout the seaside resort of Berck sur Mer from space to space.
The goal is to be the first player to complete a schedule of activities (find accommodation, a restaurant to eat, go shopping, etc.) before arriving at the "town hall" space.
The players also have local banknotes to practice all their activities.
It's up to them to manage their expenses properly in a similar way as monopoly ...

boardgame.name: Merchants of Magick: A Set a Watch Tale
boardgame.description:
In Merchants of Magick, which takes place in the "Set a Watch" universe, you are the owner of a magic item shoppe, crafting items and research­ing spells to sell to the Adventurers of the Watch.

Each round, four polyhedral dice are rolled, then you select two of them to craft items or research enchantments for your shoppe. As you craft items and research spells, you start stocking items and earn potions that let you manipulate the dice. Adventurers travel from shoppe to shoppe, so you need to stock the exact items on the order cards in front of you. If you have an item an Adventurer needs, you earn coin — but if you wait too long to fulfill an order, Adventurers will become impatient and visit your competitor next door!

After ten rounds, the player who has earned the most coin wins.

boardgame.name: The Cave of Wonders
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Cave of Wonders has been sought after by many an adventurer, as it has been told to have loot that no one has seen before. Not many adventurers have found this cave, however, so the only knowledge of this location has been through legends, stories, and old wive's tales.

Paladins from righteous brotherhoods and orders seek to find this cave, for they fear it has connections to demons and devils, to the layers of Hell from which the fiends reside.

Clerics of holy sects seek this cave, for they hear that the gods themselves reside at the middle of the cave.

Thieves and assassins search for this cave as they have heard tale of loot that will make them rich beyond rich, and they'll never have to take another job in their lives.

Bards search for this cave for want of new stories to tell, with themselves as the brave adventurers who braved the wonderous cave and lived to tell the tale.

You, on the other hand, you and your merry band of adventurers have searched for this cave for months and months. Finally, after countless hours spent, and all of your hard earned gold poured into the research of this cave, you have found it. Now, to find out what this cave is all about.

boardgame.name: Salt in the Wound
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

No outsiders stay for long in Vygrebnaya. The washed-up trade stop has been servicing merchant sloops, legitimate and otherwise, for generations. But few to none of the sailors who brave the dangerous waters of the frozen north take the normally welcome opportunity to rest on shore. Something about the village sends pinpricks up their spines. The 'something' prefers it that way.

Salt in the Wound is a location setting and adventure path that takes players from 1st to 3rd level in a far-flung northern port town. This location is setting-neutral and can be easily used to introduce players to regions like Icewind Dale in the Forgotten Realms or the bleak ice floes of Frostfell in Eberron.

Battle harsh environs, earn the respect of the village, and unconver the strange forces at work in the salt-stained port of Vygrebnaya.

boardgame.name: Thordin Battleaxe's Tome of Adventure
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Blackened husks and large piles of rubble are all that remain of most of the Village of Norad. Thin wisps of smoke rise from the few structures that managed to withstand the orc attack. Scragg the Wicked, Orc General, and follower of Krusk the Devourer, raided the village last night. Some dwarves have been taken captive. Many more died defending the village. Who will bring this vile creature to justice?

This unique book is specifically designed for brand new DMs (and players). It consists of a fully fleshed out one-shot adventure, for level 3 characters, that would take 3 or 4 hours to play through.

boardgame.name: Waterdeep: Expanded Faction Missions
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A complete rewrite of all the Faction Missions listed in Chapter 2 of Waterdeep: Dragon Heist! Brand new content that follows the spirit of those missions if not the letter, with each mission providing new, deeper looks at the city of splendors. You'll find lots of little threads that connect to other parts of the city, other storylines, other NPCs. Perfect for the DM who might look at those Faction Mission paragraphs in Dragon Heist and say 'gosh, I sure there was more than just a paragraph!' well worry not, because I've got your back!

Included is a complete 1-3 page rewrite of every single Faction Mission! From Bregan D'earthe to Zhentarim, I got you, so kick back, download the PDF, and have some faith that I got you covered, even with a beautiful cover drawn by georginoschkavincenart(tumblr), I think you're gonna find stuff you're gonna like here!

boardgame.name: The Interactive Tome of Strahd
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Explore the centuries old history of the land of Barovia side by side with the Dread Lord Strahd von Zarovich himself!

This book combines source material from decades of Ravenloft history and lore with the incredible community efforts to expand the Curse of Strahd module into 14 short adventures that chronicle Strahd's past in his own words.

Along the way, characters can meet long-dead heroes and villains of the land, learn more of the history of Barovia, hold tightly to a powerful magic item, and hopefully retain their souls along the way.

boardgame.name: A Magical Journey into the Feywild
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A Magical Journey into the Feywild is a Dungeons & Dragons 5th edition mini-adventure by Midnight Tower for a group of three to five 2nd-level characters.

The adventure can be played as a one-shot episode or as a side quest to the Hunter’s Full Moon trilogy. It can also be used in any campaign that features a region with wilderness.

An incompetent wizard accidentally teleports a young girl to the Feywild.
Enter the portal to find her and begin your magical journey.

Meet the Queen of the Green Court, talk to pixies, and fight off evil satyrs.
But beware of the wicked witches that live in Murkgrove woods.

You can sharpen your blade. You can prepare your spells. But can you survive the Feywild?

boardgame.name: Respect Your Elderly!
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Respect Your Elderly is a Dungeons & Dragons 5th edition one-shot adventure by The Natural Twenty for a group of three to five 6th-level characters.

The farmers of the great city Aradea are all reporting that their acres are depraved and that their crops are dead. Soon, the city will run out of food and famine will plague the land. A young wizard's apprentice by the name of Kyle has figured out what is causing this disaster but no one will believe him.

The city's only hope of survival is a group of elderly adventurers, currently playing bingo in their retirement home.

The fate of thousands lays in the wrinkled hands of the old guard.

boardgame.name: The Mad Mansion on Mount Baratok!
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Introduction

Rumors of a mage roaming the shores of Lake Zarovich spread throughout the small villages of Barovia. The mage’s mind is said to have fractured after coming face to face with the vampire lord Strahd Von Zarovich. He now dwells on Mount Baratok and shoots bolts of lightning at anyone foolish enough to approach. Who is this mysterious mage and has his mind truly been driven into madness?

Summary

Explore the fractured mind of Mordenkainen in this adventure supplement based on the “Mad Mage of Mount Baratok” described within the Curse of Strahd adventure by Wizards of the Coast. In this adventure, characters enter Mordenkainen’s Magnificent Mansion on Mount Baratok set in the demiplane of Barovia. After his defeat at the hands of Strahd von Zarovich, Mordenkainen fell into a downward spiral of despair, guilt, and paranoia. In desperation, he has hidden the truth of what befell from himself. As characters explore the Mad Mansion they will uncover clues to the Mage’s past while encountering puzzles, traps, and monsters.

boardgame.name: Black Dragon Priestess
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The lizardfolk of the swamp have been raiding more aggressively of late. They are being driven forth by their "god": a black dragon priestess of Tiamat.

A challenging adventure for a party of 4 level 10 characters.

boardgame.name: Alexander's Magical Experiments
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Alexander was a necromancer who was constantly obsessed with terrible ideas. There was a time when he thought he was allergic to nuts and stopped eating them. Other day he was so terrified to leave his house that he stopped going out forever. Then another day he became obsessed with the idea that a Spellcaster Slayer wanted to see him dead and so... he began to develop new spells. They were totally experimental and highly dangerous because he was playing with time and life. But everything would be worth it to stop the one who was chasing him... Alexander died several years later trying to create a Shadow Vortex, a simple cantrip that went wrong. He never faced the Spellcaster Slayer and hardly anyone remembers him anymore.

This document gathers the 6 Spells he tried to create.

boardgame.name: Book of Villainy
boardgame.description:
You're a villain, but not very good at it — Take on the role of a B-list villain who didn’t quite make the cut! In an attempt to capture at least a little bit of infamy, you’re racing other not-so-super villains to publish a book about your misdeeds. Travel around the city hiring dastardly henchman, building outrageous gadgets, and committing pranks and petty crimes. Then write it all down for your (hopefully) best-selling novel!

In Book of Villainy, you move around various locations in rondel fashion, collecting sets of henchman to complete chapters for your book. You score points by collecting chapters with certain themes and arranging the chapters of your book in ascending order.

Once any player completes their book, the game ends.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: War of 1812: Andrew Jackson's War
boardgame.description:
War of 1812 - Andrew Jackson's War is the third and final of our three low complexity hex and counter wargames covering the major battles of the war between Imperial Great Britain and the still young republic of the United States of America.

This set contains everything needed to play the 12 scenarios for the Red Stick Creek War and the New Orleans campaign.
The battles covered are :

Autossee,
Burnt Corn,
Calabee creek,
Econochaca (Holy Ground),
Enitachopco creek,
Horseshoe Bend,
Kanawha,
New Orleans,
Pensacola,
Talladega,
Tallushatchee and
Villere Plantation.


Each scenario set is a stand alone game. Knowledge or components from the other games in the series are not required.

—description from the publisher's website

boardgame.name: Spirits of Vengeance - An Unofficial Game Accessory
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The Spirits of Vengeance were a team of benevolent beings who protected mankind during ancient times. They were the vestiges of God’s power bonded to human hosts calling themselves Ghost Riders. There have been different sorts of Spirits of Vengeance around the world based on each country’s customs, belief and religion. Keeping them in charge was the archangel Zadkiel, whose sole purpose was to manipulate the Spirit’s true place of origin.

boardgame.name: 22 Offerings
boardgame.description:
The game is a solitaire game about honoring the 22 Major Arcana offering the 56 cards of the Minor Arcana set. But you can't simply gift those Offerings randomly, each Arcana need to be honored with a very specific ritual.

The player keep a hand of 8 cards on the table, and 4 Major arcana, each one with one specific condition to be fulfilled (2 Kings, 3 of a kind, etc). The player can use the cards on the table to honor them, or discard them to send back one of the Major Arcana to the deck.

The game ends when all the 22 Major Arcana has been fulfilled or when there are no more Minor Arcana that can be offered.

The game has 2 game modes, a default one and another more complex that allow to get a Gift each time that an Offering is done to a Major Arcana.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Multiplicity
boardgame.description:
Multiplicity is a pure placement abstract strategy game.

The game starts on an empty hexhex board. White moves first, after which turns alternate. Moving is compulsory.

1. The restricted placement phase

White starts by placing one stone on the empty board. From that point on players take turns to:

Place a stone on a cell adjacent to the last stone placed by the opponent, and ...
... place a stone on a cell that has only vacant cells as neighbors.

When the player to move cannot make the second placement of their turn, their turn ends, the restricted placement phase ends, and the free placement phase begins.

2. The free placement phase

Now players take turns placing one stone on any vacant cell.

The game ends when the board has only 1 empty cell remaining. (Now each player has placed the same number of stones.)

The player with the highest score wins. A player's score is the product of the sizes of all his groups. Ties are rare but possible.

Several games by Christian Freeling use this "one bound, one free" placement protocol, which he began exploring in 2012.

boardgame.name: Hidden Objects Collection
Hidden Objects Collection For Nintendo Switch
boardgame.description: This value packed game is the first of its kind to combine six completely different hidden objects games into one for the Nintendo Switch platform. Each full-length game immerses the player in great stories while providing the proven fun-filled entertainment that can only be experienced by superb hidden object adventures.
boardgame.videogamecompilation: Farm Mystery: The Happy Orchard Nightmare
The Man with the Ivory Cane
Myths Of Orion: Light From The North
Where Angels Cry: Tears of the Fallen

boardgame.name: Farm Mystery: The Happy Orchard Nightmare
boardgame.description: The Happy Orchard Farm is trapped in a nightmare! People are disappearing into the mist that surrounds the town at night in this Farm Mystery. It's up to you to solve the chilling case of this haunted place. Search for clues, solve puzzles and play mini-games to uncover the secrets of the Happy Orchard nightmare.

boardgame.name: The Man with the Ivory Cane
boardgame.description:
Discover early 20th century Paris in this intriguing story of crime, love and destiny! Solve a missing girl case and expose a puppet master that’s trying to pull your strings.

Not many people know this, but the City of Love harbours more than passion on the romantic riverside. It’s up to you to go beneath the surface… and come back with evidence! Are you up to the challenge? Put your puzzle solving skill to the ultimate test and escape hidden traps.
Discover the mystery behind the Man with the Ivory Cane or Paris will never be the same!

boardgame.name: Where Angels Cry: Tears of the Fallen
Where Angels Cry: Tears of the Fallen Collector's Edition
boardgame.description:
You have a new assignment! Dive back to 13th century medieval Europe as Vatican's best secret agent!
Rumors have it that inquisitor Augustine went out of his mind. He became obsessed by witch-hunting. People are in terror. Travel to Spain, to an isolated village of Portonero and bring an end to this witch-hunting madness! No one is safe; no one is spared from inquisitor's blood-stained hands. Can you be the one that will bring peace and justice back to Portonero and his people?

Collector's Edition on the Switch includes a bonus prequel campaign that lets you play out the origin story of the characters.

boardgame.name: Micro Chapbook RPG: The Card Game
boardgame.description:
The card game version of the popular solo roleplaying game!

Enter the dungeon with up to 4 heroes! Fight monsters, avoid traps, visit underground taverns and shops, share the wealth, become the heroes of legend. OR, be greedy and keep the gold for yourself, cause disention in the party, come out of the dungeon alone!

Micro Chapbook RPG: The Card Game is a fast and fun dungeon crawler based upon the popular solo roleplaying game system. Play the game solo or invite over some friends for some dungeon crawling goodness. ALSO, use the dungeon cards included here in your normal Micro Chapbook Adventures to help you build interesting new layouts each time!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: After School Ghost Club
boardgame.description:
When the Ghost Club dares you to go into the abandoned school, you accept. After all, as a member of the Ghost Club yourself you don’t want to look like a coward. So, after stepping through the front doors, you quickly realize you’re locked inside! It seems the only way to get the doors open again is to capture the ghosts whose energy is keeping them shut!

One player takes the role of the student while the other takes the role of the ghosts. The goal is different for both. The student is trying to escape the school after capturing enough ghosts. The Ghost is trying to reduce the Student to 0 Health or bar them from ever escaping the school again!

Perfect for fans of horror anime and games such as Corpse Party, Fatale Frame, Ghost Hunt, and more!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Terror in the Theater
boardgame.description:
Dear Detective,

If you are receiving this letter, it is because I am dead. Dark forces beyond anything you can imagine have converged upon me and taken my life from me . . . or perhaps something worse.

I have seen horrors beyond what the normal human mind can comprehend. Strange yellow mists that swirl in the streets, actors dressed in robes who have no face, and a looming figure standing on the stage of Arkham Theater--waiting just beyond some unseen veil to come into our world.

It has taken all of my willpower simply not to go insane.

I’ve been investigating a strange underground society in the theater district of Arkham. They claim to be a thespians society, an acting club, but I know for a fact they are a cult--a cult hellbent on bringing doom to our world. This is the very thing I was trying to prevent.

Now . . . it is up to you to stop them once and for all.

Tonight, they are putting on a play . . . a horrific performance that is the final rites to summon The King in Yellow. The play must be performed in complete darkness for the summoning to work.

Go to Arkham Theater. Light every lantern in the damn building to keep them from finishing that play. Get evidence to reveal their evil scheme once and for all!

Sincerely,

A Friend

P.S. For heavens sake, keep those damn lanterns lit!

Terror in the Theater is a Roll+Write role-playing game of Horror Investigation set in 1920s New England. You, the detective/investigator, are following the pleas of a dead friend to check out the theater in the town of Arkham. It is there you will find the horrors you need to face.

boardgame.name: There is Something in the House!
boardgame.description:
As a lifelong member of the Tokyo police force, you have seen and investigated many horrific things. However, nothing left you as disturbed or shaken as the house. . . The house was one of your very first investigations after being promoted to Detective. An elderly woman who lived there disappeared for months, inciting a missing person investigation, only to have her turn up a year later in the empty home . . . her head removed. You never did figure out where the woman vanished to in all those months, and you never figured out who killed her. All you know is that after you stepped foot in the house, your life took a turn for the worse. Your wife died, your home burned down, and things never seemed to get better. Now, near retirement and severely alcoholic, you are determined to go back to the house and figure out just what is going on in there once and for all. Somehow, however, you know that whatever is living there . . . it is evil.

There is Something in the House is a simple Roll+Write inspired by Japanese horror media. It is a miniature print and play-style board game with storytelling elements where you take on the role of a retiring police detective. All you need is the 2 game sheets, a pencil, and some dice.

Turn down the lights, turn on some spooky music, and play by candlelight!

boardgame.name: Pulp City: Cold War
boardgame.description: Pulp City expansion adding two new factions, Supreme Alliance and Red Republik.

boardgame.name: Adventura
boardgame.description:
There are countless wonders around the world, each with its own peculiarity, such as treasures, artifacts and also sinister mysteries. In Adventura, you are an explorer in search of emotions and to discover the greatest secrets in the world.
Adventura is an exploration game for 1 to 4 players. The game mainly follows the roll and write mechanics. Divided by turns, each player can choose to explore a location, travel to another location or perform actions such as shopping, improving their team and equipment.
The goal is to earn the highest score by finding all the hidden treasures on the maps.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Black Dragon (Volume 1, Number 2)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The second issue of Black Dragon contains a fun article on creating interesting henchmen, a new way to handle equipment inventory, a look back at "The Domains of Dread," and a miniatures review looking at orcs!

boardgame.name: Liber Genus VI: Serpentfolk
Serpentfolk
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Have you ever looked at a creature and thought, "hmm, that would be interesting to play"? Have you thought it a shame that some creatures look like you could walk down the street in your game as one yet there are no hard rules on how to do that? Well the Liber Genus series aims to fill that niche.

This sixth installment brings the secretive serpentfolk to the table, with rules on how to create a character as an ancestry. Incorporating 3 heritages focusing on mental or physical prowess as well as 15 ancestry feats and 2 magical items.

boardgame.name: What Lies Beyond
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Traverse the Infinite!

Far beyond the reaches of Vandara lies a vast multiverse of horrors and wonders. Amidst the blackness of eons, beings of incomprehensible age and magnitude war with each for the destiny of all of the universe. In their wake, countless miracles both scientific and magical lie strewn across the cosmos. To uncover the mysteries of these countless interstellar beings is to recognize how infinitesimal even the greatest triumphs of Vandara or Aurin truly are.

Arcforge Campaign Setting: What Lies Beyond is the final installment exploring the Arcforge universe, bringing you a treasure trove of Starfinder Roleplaying Game and Pathfinder Roleplaying Game rules and options for players and GMs alike alongside extensive lore and mechanics for the vaster cosmology of the Arcforge universe. Uncover the nature of the planes and learn about the forces which govern them with incredible options for GMs and players alike! Learn of the Logi, the seven guiding forces at the heart of cosmic conflict! Harness the might of Mythic Sphere Masteries for the Pilot and Technomancy spheres while invoking new spells and powers such as Biocloaking, Event Horizon, and Voidsong! Deal with strange outer powers such as Zenith Aeons, Hero Passages, Meggidon Titans, and Nihileon Unmakers! Finally, build a wide variety of new monsters with eight new Templates, ranging from the nightmarish Silenced to the brilliant Unshackled AI!

boardgame.name: The Battle of Red Cliffs: Origami Score Tower
boardgame.description: Origami Score Tower was a Kickstarter reward for keeping score when playing The Battle of Red Cliffs.

boardgame.name: MixClay
boardgame.description:
Sculpting Party Game of mixing the shapes defined by keywords to create your unique piece in clay and guessing other players mixes.

Imagine wild mixes: Bread+Cat , Pretzel+Eiffel Tower
and etc..

Players secretly chooses two keywords from different cards in their hand, and try to the best of their abilities and creativity to create one single sculpture in clay that mixes the shapes of chosen keywords. Players use their hands and sculpting tool to sculpt the piece.

Then, players try to guess other players keywords by looking at other players sculptures.

You gain points by creatively mixing the shapes, people correct guessing your keywords and by guessing other players keywords. Keywords have different levels of difficulty.

—description from the designer
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Mechanism: Give a Clue / Get a Clue

boardgame.name: Micro Chapbook RPG: The Board Game
boardgame.description:
Micro Chapbook RPG is a board game of fantasy adventure using the popular Micro Chapbook RPG game system. Players will create their own characters from scratch using the ultra-simple rules included here. Those heroes will set out on grand adventures across the land of Hellik Water.

Travel in the open overworld hunting monsters for gold and picking up quests. Enter the dungeons of the land to kill mighty villains and earn clout and fame.

This game stands on its own as a complete adventure board game BUT may also be used as a supplement for the Micro Chapbook Roleplaying Game system.

Included in the print and play version is:


A two-section square board game. The World Map and the Dungeon Map.
A Deck of Character Portraits.
A Deck of Quest Cards.
A Deck of Location Cards.
A Deck of Spell Cards.
Damage Cards
Character Sheets
Game Instructions
Build Tips

boardgame.name: Flottenspiel
boardgame.description:
The game board is divided into four sections, one for each player. The players have to get as many of their four ships as possible from space 1 to space 24 to win the game. Movement is determined by a number die and a special die. The special die decides which of the four ships is to be moved: L= Linienschiff, T= Torpedoboot, K= Kreuzer, S= Schulschiff, blank (2x)= no ship.

If a ship gets on a space with an image wich is already occupied by an enemy ship in another section, this enemy ship has to begin from space 1 again.

Whenever two ships get on the same numbered space, they constitute a bockade and the player gets two coins from each other player.

On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. On space 24 the ship is destroyed and is eliminated from the game.

—user summary

boardgame.name: The 7th Citadel: Le Dernier Trône
The 7th Citadel: The Final Throne
boardgame.description:
The Final Throne is a new Threat with a more "political" storyline than previous adventures, in which you will also find a new use for the laminated world map that comes with your Collector's Edition.

In this Threat, you will interact with several iconic groups and individuals, never knowing who you can trust – and yet, it will be your wise alliances that will determine the fate of the Collapsing Lands!

We could tell you more, but that would spoil the pleasure inherent in discovering this plot…

This Threat includes 126 cards, a 36+ page Threat booklet and 1 blank Citadel leaflet.

-description from the Kickstarter campaign

Game weight: 0.100 kg
Title: Tiny Towns: Bomen (NL) Publisher: White Goblin Games Language(s): Dutch

boardgame.name: Papua
boardgame.description:
Each player receives task boards with exotic islands. They must be connected with bridges as soon as possible! Players have at their disposal construction fragments of various shapes and lengths. Build, rotate, twist and combine with bridge settings. Watch out for volcanoes! Whoever solves their puzzle the fastest wins the respect of the local Papuans and victory points. Three difficulty levels will allow you to adjust the game to the age and skills of the players.

—description from the publisher

•••

Każdy gracz otrzymuje plansze zadania z egzotycznymi wyspami. Trzeba je jak najszybciej połączyć mostami! Gracze mają do dyspozycji fragmenty konstrukcji o różnych kształtach i długości. Buduj, obracaj, przekręcaj i kombinuj z ustawieniami mostów. Uważaj na wulkany! Kto najszybciej rozwiąże swoją łamigłówkę, zdobywa szacunek miejscowych Papuasów i punkty zwycięstwa. Trzy poziomy trudności pozwolą dostosować grę do wieku i umiejętności graczy.

—opis wydawcy

boardgame.name: Nur nicht aufregen
boardgame.description:
The players have to get their 4 meeples (or as many as possible) from space A to space 100. Movement is determined by a die. If a meeple gets on a space occupied by another player, the later has to return his meeple to the home area.

On the roll of a 6 or by reaching space 10, 20, 30, 40, 50, 60, 70, 80 or 90 another meeple may move from a home space to Space A or from Space A onto the race track.

If a player gets on spaces 17, 33, 67 or 83 the meeple gets arrested. Only on the roll of a 5 a meeple may leave an arrest cell.

A meeple getting on space 50 is in prison and stays there for the reminder of the game.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Dark Nebula Mission Guide
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

For a thousand centuries the Ascendancy ruled the galaxy, but now the empire has fallen into an age of decadence and decay. Ambitious nobles and barbarian conquerors vie for power. Heroes armed with star swords and phase pistols seek the mysterious artifacts of a forgotten age. Finally, an ancient enemy has returned to the galaxy: one by one, the stars are going out.

The Dark Nebula Mission Guide contains everything you need to run an evocative, far-future campaign for the Alternity Science Fiction Roleplaying Game. This sourcebook includes:


An overview of the factions, threats, aliens, and key locales of the Dark Nebula setting.
Five ready-to-play adventure episodes set in the dying empire of the Ascendancy.
An appendix introducing three new player character species: the stealthy dyanthi, robot heroes, and the feral zendi.

boardgame.name: Xenologist's Guide
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

No space opera setting would be complete without strange planets teeming with hungry or hostile aliens. Vicious predators, territorial mineral beings, carnivorous plants, sharp-toothed swarms, space eels... if you can imagine a dangerous alien creature, it's out there somewhere.

The Xenologist's Guide is a compendium of more than 50 new adversaries for the Alternity Science Fiction Roleplaying Game from Sasquatch Game Studio. It includes adversaries from threat rating 1 to threat rating 12, with a variety of minons, champions, and bosses to provide challenges for missions of all levels. The Guide also includes a detailed creature design appendix to help you create your own alien adversaries.

boardgame.name: Volterra
boardgame.description:
In medieval times in Volterra, Tuscany, it was custom for rival families to compete to construct buildings. The higher the tower, the wealthier the family. To this day, the vestiges of this contest — the "dynasty towers" — remain visible in many Tuscan towns.

Wealth is not important in the tactical game Volterra. Here, the towers rise upwards thanks to the tactical skill of the master builders. The pieces in play are stacked on top of each other, step by step. The play counters do their utmost to defend towers of their own color. Building continues on the shrinking play area until no counters can move. Now, who is sitting atop the highest tower?

—description from the publisher

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet

listing.notes:
Spieleranzahl: 2 bis 2 Spieldauer: 15 Minuten Altersempfehlung: 8+
VOLTERRA - Wer baut den höchsten Turm Im mittelalterlichen Volterra wurde um die Wette gebaut. Je höher der Turm, desto wohlhabender waren die Besitzer. Bis heute finden sich die Überreste dieses Bauwettbewerbs, die sogenannten „Geschlechtertürme“, in vielen Städten der Toskana. Im Strategiespiel VOLTERRA spielt Reichtum keine Rolle. Hier wachsen die Türme durch das taktische Geschick ihrer Baumeister*innen in die Höhe. Die Steine des Spielfelds werden Zug um Zug aufeinandergestapelt und die Spielfiguren tun ihr Möglichstes, um die Türme der eigenen Farbe zu verteidigen. Auf dem schrumpfenden Spielfeld wird solange gebaut, bis die Figuren sich nicht mehr bewegen können. Wer sitzt jetzt auf dem höchsten Turm?
Inhalt: 20 Spielsteine 2 Spielfiguren
https://youtu.be/L2eaixKAnUg
Mit Spielregeln in folgenden Sprachen: DE, EN, FR, ES

boardgame.name: Soaring Lions
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Soaring Lions brings the drama, theatre and pageantry of professional wrestling to tabletop roleplaying. Players take the role of amazing heroes and despicable villains in a fast-paced, winner-takes-all, competition.

This game is about getting to the action quickly and building your wrestler’s story through a mix of matches and backstage drama. Character creation is simple; wrestlers are built from basic elements which you can create yourself, or roll randomly using the Legend Machine.

In a single session (or Big Show), you’ll build your character’s acclaim as you compete in matches, form alliances with other wrestlers and grab the mic to call others out. You can cash in your acclaim to generate extra effort in a match, book special matches and claim titles to seize glory.

Do you crave more action, more glory and an even bigger stage? If so, playing a Big Series allows you to build a character’s storyline over a longer period, linking several Big Shows. Between shows you spend glory points to upgrade your character to do things like developing a devastating special move, attaining celebrity status or adding devoted followers to your retinue.

The Big Series concludes with a winner-takes-all Battle Royale match that features all of the characters competing for the ultimate prize.

This is a complete game for 2 or more players - there’s no need for anyone to take the role of facilitator or Game Master (GM), but if you’d rather have an offstage role, off-stage options are included to amplify the drama and help bring the characters to life.

boardgame.name: Soaring Lions: Throwdown
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In Soaring Lions: Throwdown, a major professional wrestling title belt has just been vacated by a retiring wrestling legend, and an open competition is held to determine who will get a shot at the title and a chance to write their own legend!

Soaring Lions brings the drama, theatre and pageantry of professional wrestling to tabletop roleplaying. Players take the role of amazing heroes and despicable villains in a fast-paced, winner-takes-all, competition.

Character creation is simple; wrestlers are built from basic elements which you can create yourself, or roll randomly using the Legend Machine. Each character battles for the title, through a series of elimination matches, where winners progress to the next round.

Players of eliminated characters have a key role, determining which characters receive fan acclaim, based on the descriptions of events in the ring.

This is a complete game for 2 or more players intended to showcase Soaring Lions - there’s no need for anyone to take the role of facilitator or Game Master (GM).

boardgame.name: Freedom for Otello
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The final fight for the Rooku Stone appears to be destined for the city on the front lines of the humanoid war. All you have to do is get into the Gulag and find more clues...simple!

Although set in the Pangia Campaign, this adventure setting is easily adaptable to most any game and system.

boardgame.name: Rettet Rapunzel
boardgame.description:
How can we free Rapunzel from her dark tower? No, not by climbing up her braids of hair! We simply deconstruct the tower, piece by piece. But defying all logic, we don't start at the top of the tower, but at the bottom! Using a wooden disc, we attempt to perfect our aim to knock out the tower piece at the base — but without the tower collapsing!

It's all because of the law of gravity. Of course, not every go is successful — and that's half the fun. After all, the other players also want their turn.

Who will bring Rapunzel safely down to terra firma in Rettet Rapunzel?

—description from the publisher

RETTET RAPUNZEL - Die Schwerkraft spielt mit! Wie können wir Rapunzel aus ihrem dunklen Turm befreien?! Nein, wir müssen nicht an ihrem Zopf hinaufklettern — wir bauen den Turm einfach Stück für Stück ab. Und entgegen aller Logik fangen wir damit nicht oben an, sondern unten! Mit Hilfe einer Holzscheibe und etwas Treffsicherheit können wir jeweils die unterste Etage des Turms herausschnippen — ohne, dass das Gebäude umstürzt! Das Gesetz der Schwerkraft machts möglich. Natürlich gelingt es nicht immer, wäre auch langweilig… Die Anderen wollen schließlich auch mal an die Reihe kommen. Wem gelingt es, Rapunzel wohlbehalten auf die Erde herunter zu holen?!
Inhalt: 11 Turmteile 1 Spielfigur
Mit Spielregeln in folgenden Sprachen: DE, EN, FR, ES

boardgame.name: Ship Dossier: Kalevala Class Small Pickets
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

What's the best ship to repsond to a pirate attack or mount a search and rescue mission?

The one you have.

The 'real' Navy might be tens of light years away. Its dreadnought might be patrolling worlds deemed higher priority. Worlds on the frontier have to provide their own protection and a picket is often the best they can afford.

Enter the Kalevala Class Small Picket. Affordable, fast, and enough armament to make a pirate think twice. The ship also excels at search and rescue, transporting precious cargos and almost anything else! Best of all, it won't bereak your defense budget and is economical enough for less developed worlds and private security firms to afford. Buy several to patrol hot spots, serve and protect.

Piracy just got harder.

This is a supplement providing color and visuals of a commonly found starship. It is designed around 2d6 game systems.

boardgame.name: Monsters Mythica: Dread Coachman
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

“Have I been cursed? Once again I was upon the ramparts on Pallowen and once again the gods granted me a terrible vision. I was doing my patrols when the air grew so chill I thought I would freeze in my armor. Suddenly I heard a terrible racket from above and looked up to see a carriage, pulled by spectral horses and driven by a coachman so horrible I thought my heart would seize up. I watched as he passed over one of my fellow guards and pulled him into his wretched cart before vanishing into the night sky. I will never forget it. And I will certainly be switching shifts next year.”
- From the report of Falen Cooper, wall guard

The crack of a whip. The terrible clattering of hooves cutting through the still night air. The ghastly inevitability of what this creature of retribution carries with it in its loathsome carriage. These are the details of stories whispered by cutthroats in back alleys and by bandits around their campfires. Tales of punishment for crimes left unanswered and of victims left unavenged. Beware they say, with their eyes turned toward the starless sky and what it holds beyond its borders. Beware the dread coachman.

This supplement includes:

Lore and statistics on the dread coachman.
Plot hooks to get your party of adventurers involved with this new creature.
An exclusive artifact that can be found after an encounter with the dread coachman - the whip of all sorrows!

boardgame.name: Gioco Delle Tre Oche
boardgame.description:
A children's boardgame printed in Italy during WWII. It seems that it was printed around the time of the Italian armistice. It is presumably produced in the areas of Italy occupied by Fascist forces as the three geese in the title are America, Britain and USSR and the board appears to give you advantages for landing on Axis themed spaces. It seems to be a roll and move game and the playing pieces and dice are printed next to the board for cutting and assembling. The aim of the game is to reach the center of the board where victory is achieved by the loyal Italian Fascist forces.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Palavan
boardgame.description:
A paradise island landscape is regrettably separated into different pieces. The aim is to connect the islands again!

At the basic level, the South Seas puzzle has multiple solutions and many spellbinding panoramic views of the island. A player can choose to set the goal higher in challenging game variants in search of the perfect island.

In addition to a mind-teasing game of solitaire, two players can take turns place their tiles in Palavan, with each trying to lay out all their personal tiles while making life difficult for the opponent. Life can sometimes get mean, even in an island paradise...

—description from the publisher

PALAVAN - Legespiel Eine paradiesische Insellandschaft ist leider in kleine Einzelteile zerschnitten. Nun gilt es, die Inseln wieder auferstehen zu lassen! Im ersten Level des Südsee-Puzzles gibt es jede Menge Lösungen und ebenso viele schöne Inselpanoramen. Wer möchte, kann die Latte höher legen und sich in den anspruchsvollen Varianten auf die Suche nach der perfekten Insel machen.
PALAVAN ist ein kniffliges Solitärspiel - aber nicht nur das: In der Version für zwei Spieler*innen werden die Kärtchen im Wechsel gelegt, mit dem Ziel, die eigenen alle unterzubekommen und dem Gegenüber das Leben schwer zu machen.
Im Inselparadies kann es auch ganz schön gemein zugehen…

Mit Spielregeln in folgenden Sprachen: DE, EN, FR, ES

boardgame.name: Captain Hartchild's Guide to Rare Dragons
boardgame.description:
Publisher description:

Captain Hartchild's Guide to Rare Dragons is a 5e-compatible sourcebook that includes

- 10 Unique Dragons. We have 8 authors on this project, each of which was in complete creative control of their own dragon. The end result is a wide variety of creatures.

- Intricate Detail. Each dragon has original art, stats, motivations, histories, hoards, minions, and other features. If you were a backer of Oceanic Depths, you'll find these dragons equitable to the villains found there.

- Maps & Magic Items. Dragons with physical lairs have accompanying maps within this volume. In addition, each dragon has new, unique magic items within its possession.

boardgame.name: Quadrato
boardgame.description:
Each player has 12 (small edition) or 18 (large edition) game pieces. In turns the players place one of their pieces on the game board, trying to occupy all four corners (yellow dots)of any square. When all pieces are set, movement begins. Movement is one space in any direction.

If a player completes a square, he may capture any opponent piece not being part of a completed square ant put it in the center of his new square. Pieces that are part of a square may not be moved for the reminder of the game.

The first player to complete 4 (or 6 with the large edition) squares wins the game.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Thunderstone Quest: Neoprene Mat
boardgame.description:
The Playmat is double-sided. One side is the "day" layout for competitive play. And the reverse is the "night" side with spaces for the Barricades board overlays, showing the Village partially destroyed. The "night" side is intentionally darker than the day side to reflect the perilous condition of the Village!

The Playmat is sized so that it can fit within either the Champion or the To The Barricades box, box, rolled up. The length is 300 mm.

boardgame.name: Agrópolis: Invasión
Agropolis: Invasion
boardgame.description:
A one card disaster hits Agropolis.

Invading UFOs are abducting our livestock! Protect your livestock by keeping them away.

Invasion adds a card to the deck that covers the previously played card when it comes to the top of the draw pile and incurs scoring penalties.


1-card promo that mirrors Sprawlopolis: Wrecktar.

boardgame.name: Agropolis: Points of Interest
Agrópolis: Puntos de Interés
boardgame.description:
A one card assistant visits Agropolis.

Neighboring farmers want to lend a hand!

Points of Interest helps you by giving you a starting card that gives you a bonus point for each matching block surrounding the Point of Interest.


1-card promo that mirrors Sprawlopolis: Points of Interest.

boardgame.name: Fliegender Holländer
boardgame.description:
The players start with 10 ships (plastic tokens) each at their starting spaces. Movement is determined by 2 dice. The result of both dice may be used for one ship or the result of each die for another ship. The players may chose to bring a new ship into play or move a ship already on the board.

The ships may be placed on empty spaces or on top of ships of the same color but never on top of enemy ships. If a ship gets on a space with a single enemy ship, the enemy ship is taken from the board and has to start anew. A single ship can't be taken, when it is protected by friendly ships on the space directly behind it.

If a ship gets on an unprotected stack of enemy ships, only one enemy ship is taken from the board, the rest are set back according the roll of one die for each ship.

The game ends when all 16 spaces in the center of the board are occupied. The player with the most ships in the center spaces defeats the Flying Dutchman and wins the game. Ships that sail past the center spaces have to complete their journey and then start again.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Camisa 12
boardgame.description:
Soccer is in the blood. Being a fan goes far beyond just liking a team. Being a fan is going to the stadium, singing the classic songs, raising flags in their colors, doing the wave… Being a fan is being part of the team on the field!

Camisa 12 is a game for 2 players, where you will lead a group of soccer fans of your favorite team. Each player will be one side of a football crowd in a great football classic. You need to cheer for your team to help it score goals by making mosaics, huge flags, waves, fireworks and chants. All for the win!
You must fill your side of the stadium with crowd tiles, trying to score points so your team can score more goals than your opponent. Whoever has more goals by the end of the match wins. If there’s a tie, the match goes to penalty kickouts.

It's time to make the field shake!

—description from the publisher
